Package me.ryandw11.ods

Class ODS

java.lang.Object
me.ryandw11.ods.ODS
public class ODS
extends java.lang.Object
This is a utility class that provided wrappers for the different tags. All wrappers exclude a name.

This class also contains overall settings for ODS.

  • Constructor Details

      public ODS()

  • Method Details

    • wrap

      public static Tag<?> wrap​(java.lang.Object o)
      Wrap an object to a tag.

      The name is not set by this method.

      This method cannot wrap Lists, Maps. Objects are automatically serialized.

      Parameters:
      o - The object to wrap.
      Returns:
      The tag equivalent.

    • wrap

      public static Tag<?> wrap​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object o)
      Wrap an object to a tag.

      This method cannot wrap Lists, Maps. Objects are automatically serialized.

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the tag to wrap.
      o - The object to wrap.
      Returns:
      The tag equivalent.

    • unwrap

      public static <T> T unwrap​(Tag<T> tag)
      Unwrap a tag and turn it back into it's original value.

      This method will not work for Lists, Maps, and Objects.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The data type of the tag.
      Parameters:
      tag - The tag to unwrap.
      Returns:
      The unwrapped tag.

    • wrap

      public static <T> ListTag<?> wrap​(java.lang.String name, java.util.List<T> list)
      Wrap a list into a list tag.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The data type of the list.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the list tag.
      list - The list to turn into a list tag.

      The list can only contain objects that can be converted into tags. The contents of the list are automatically wrapped. Note: This list cannot contain Objects, Lists, or Maps.

      Returns:
      The wrapped list.

    • wrap

      public static <T> java.util.List<Tag<?>> wrap​(java.util.List<T> list)
      Wrap all of the objects inside of the list.

      The same limitations apply as with the wrap(Object) method.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The data type of the list.
      Parameters:
      list - The list to wrap.
      Returns:
      The wrapped list.

    • unwrapList

      public static <T> java.util.List<T> unwrapList​(java.util.List<Tag<T>> tags)
      Unwrap a list full of tags.

      This method is not for unwrapping the LinkList to a normal list.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The data type of the tags.

      The list must be a uniform data type.

      Parameters:
      tags - The list of tags.
      Returns:
      The unwrapped list.

    • unwrapListTag

      public static <T> java.util.List<T> unwrapListTag​(ListTag<? extends Tag<T>> list)
      Unwrap a ListTag into a list.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The data type of the list.
      Parameters:
      list - The ListTag to convert back into a list.

      The contents of the list are automatically unwrapped.

      Returns:
      The unwrapped list.

    • serialize

      public static ObjectTag serialize​(java.lang.String key, java.lang.Object obj)
      Serialize an object.
      Parameters:
      key - The key
      obj - The object
      Returns:
      The object tag.

    • deserialize

      public static <T> T deserialize​(Tag<?> tag, java.lang.Class<T> mainClazz)
      Deserialize back into an object
      Type Parameters:
      T - The deserialized class.
      Parameters:
      tag - The tag.
      mainClazz - The main class.
      Returns:
      The object.

    • registerCustomTag

      public static void registerCustomTag​(Tag<?> tag)
      Register a custom tag into the system. (This tag must respect the reserved tag ids).
      Parameters:
      tag - The tag class to add.

    • getCustomTags

      public static java.util.List<Tag<?>> getCustomTags()
      Get the list of custom tags.
      Returns:
      The list of custom tags.

    • allowUndefinedTags

      public static void allowUndefinedTags​(boolean value)
      Informs ods whether or not to thrown an error when it comes across an undefined custom tag.

      Only enable this when developing something like a visualizer program.

      Parameters:
      value - Whether or not to thrown an error when it comes across an undefined custom tag.
